Package model.basic

Class Session

  • java.lang.Object
    • model.basic.Session
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<Session>
    public class Session
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable<Session>
    A class representing a session. A session is a block of one or more consecutive lessons with the same teacher(s), students in the same room on the same day.
    Version:
    1 - 2 December 2021
    Author:
    Christian Foyer, Kamil Fischbach, Martin Rosendahl, Nina Wrona, Robert Barta

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      static int LENGTHOFLESSON
      The length of a lesson is 45 minutes and the length of a break is 10 minutes.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Session​(Course course, Date date, Time startTime, int numberOfLessons)
      Four-argument constructor taking a course object representing what course is taught in the given session, a copy of a date object displaying the date on which the session will be held, the start time, and the number of lessons.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Session

        public Session​(Course course,
               Date date,
               Time startTime,
               int numberOfLessons)
        Four-argument constructor taking a course object representing what course is taught in the given session, a copy of a date object displaying the date on which the session will be held, the start time, and the number of lessons.
        Parameters:
        course - name of the taught course
        date - the date on which the session takes place
        startTime - the time at which the session begins
        numberOfLessons - the number of lessons in the session

      • getStartTime

        public Time getStartTime()
        A getter method returning a Time object representing the time at which the session begins.
        Returns:
        the Time at which the session begins.

      • getEndTime

        public Time getEndTime​(Time startTime,
                       int numberOfLessons)
        A method returning a Time object representing the time at which a session ends. The end time of a session is calculated by multiplying the value of the two parameters: the number of lessons with the length of a lesson(45 minutes per lesson and a 10-minute break included). The result is subtracted by 10 (representing a redundant break at the end of the last lesson). The result is then converted into a valid hours and minutes format.
        Parameters:
        startTime - the time at which the session starts
        numberOfLessons - the number of lessons the session contains
        Returns:
        a Time object representing the time at which the session ends.

      • getEndTime

        public Time getEndTime()
        An overridden method returning the end time of a session. This method takes no parameters. The end time of a session is calculated by multiplying the number of lessons with the length of a lesson (45 minutes per lesson and a 10-minute break included). The result is subtracted by 10 (representing a redundant break at the end of the last lesson). The result is then converted into a valid hours and minutes format.
        Returns:
        a Time object representing the time at which the session ends.

      • isOverlapped

        public boolean isOverlapped​(Time timeStart,
                            int numberOfLessons)
        A method checking if two sessions are overlapped. A second Time object is created inside the method using the two parameters: a Time object representing the time at which the session to be compared with begins, and an integer representing the number of lessons in that session (referred to as Session 2). There are six if-statements checking for the six different possible scenarios: 1. Session 1 begins and ends before Session 2 begins. This is NOT considered an overlap. 2. Session 1 begins before Session 2 and ends after Session 2 begins. This is considered an overlap. 3. Session 1 begins after Session 2 begins and ends before Session 2 ends. This is considered an overlap. 4. Session 2 begins and ends before Session 1 begins. This is NOT considered an overlap. 5. Session 2 begins after Session 1 begins and ends before Session 1 ends. This is considered an overlap. 6. Session 2 begins before Session 1 and ends after Session 1 begins. This is considered an overlap. 7. Session 1 and Session 2 begin at the same time. 8. Session 1 and Session 2 ends at the same time.
        Parameters:
        timeStart - the time at which Session 2 starts.
        numberOfLessons - the number of lessons inside Session 2.
        Returns:
        "True" for scenario 2, 3, 5, 6, 7 and 8, or "False" for scenario 1 and 4.

      • isOverlapped

        public boolean isOverlapped​(Session other)
        An overridden method checking if the current session and the one from the parameter (referred to as Session 2) are overlapped. There are seven if-statements checking for the nine different possible scenarios: 1. Session 1 begins and ends before Session 2 begins. This is NOT considered an overlap. 2. Session 1 begins before Session 2 and ends after Session 2 begins. This is considered an overlap. 3. Session 1 begins after Session 2 begins and ends before Session 2 ends. This is considered an overlap. 4. Session 2 begins and ends before Session 1 begins. This is NOT considered an overlap. 5. Session 2 begins after Session 1 begins and ends before Session 1 ends. This is considered an overlap. 6. Session 2 begins before Session 1 and ends after Session 1 begins. This is considered an overlap. 7. Session 1 and Session 2 begin at the same time. 8. Session 1 and Session 2 end at the same time. 9. Session 1 and Session 2 are on two different dates.
        Parameters:
        other - an object of type Session representing Session 2.
        Returns:
        "True" for scenario 2, 3, 5, 6, 7 and 8, or "False" for scenario 1, 4 and 9.

      • setNumberOfLessons

        public void setNumberOfLessons​(int numberOfLessons)
        A setter method setting the number of lessons for a session. The method will throw an exception if the number of lessons would push the end of the session outside the valid time-frame: 8:20-17:55. Normally the lunch break is not considered as a slot for lessons, but it is possible to book it, with a maximum of 7 lessons, ending at 17:55
        Parameters:
        numberOfLessons - the number of lessons to be set for the session.

      • getStartTimeString

        public java.lang.String getStartTimeString()
        A method returning a String representation of the session's start time in a "hh:mm" format.
        Returns:
        a string representing the start time of the session.

      • getEndTimeString

        public java.lang.String getEndTimeString()
        A method calculating and returning a String representation of the session's end time in a "hh:mm" format. The end time of a session is calculated by multiplying the number of lessons with the length of a lesson (45 minutes per lesson and a 10-minute break included). The result is subtracted by 10 (representing a redundant break at the end of the last lesson). The result is then converted into a valid hours and minutes format. In case of booking a session through the lunch break, 10 more minutes are subtracted; no break after the lesson of 12:00-12:45.
        Returns:
        a string representing the time at which the session ends.

      • copySessionToDate

        public Session copySessionToDate​(Date otherDate)
        A method for creating a copy of a Session.
        Parameters:
        otherDate - date of the other session.
        Returns:
        Returns a copy of Session with another date.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        A method returning the string representation of the session's details.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        A string containing the name of the course, the class group, the start time, the number of lessons, the end time and the room (or unassigned room) of a session.

      • shortString

        public java.lang.String shortString()
        A method returning the string representation of some of the session's details.
        Returns:
        a String containing course name, date, and room or "unassigned" if the room is null.

      • compareTo

        public int compareTo​(Session obj)
        A Method for comparing sessions based on their start times.
        Specified by:
        compareTo in interface java.lang.Comparable<Session>
        Parameters:
        obj - the Session object to be compared with.
        Returns:
        -1, 0, or 1 depending on the values of the start times in seconds.
